Column Comment.0: SPATIAL PARCELOHIO LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcels included inthe Ohio Survey system. These parcels may be referenced when describing thespatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.3: AREA TYPE ID: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.4: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.5: DESCRIPTION: Describes areas which are only partially included in the land parcelsmallest unit described (such as quarter LSD for DLS survey system)
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: Date on which the land parcel became effective
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.8: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.9: MAP QUADRANGLE: USGS map quadrangle scale, either 7.5 or 15 minute areasizes.
Column Comment.10: MAP QUADRANGLE NAME: Name of the USGS quadrangle in which the welllocation falls.
Column Comment.11: OHIO ALLOTMENT: Allotment irregular subdivision. Found in the CONNECTICUTWESTERN RESERVE, DONATION TRACT and UNITED STATES MILITARYDISTRICT Land Subdivision areas.
Column Comment.12: OHIO DIVISION: Division irregular subdivision. Found in the CONNECTICUTWESTERN RESERVE and UNITED STATES MILITARY DISTRICT LandSubdivision areas.
Column Comment.13: OHIO FRACTION: Fraction irregular subdivision, including direction if available.Found in various Land Subdivision areas.
Column Comment.14: OHIO LAND SUBDIVISION NAME: Ohio Original Land Subdivision name. There are44 distinct Land Subdivisions in the Ohio Department of Natural Resources (ODNR)ORIGINAL LAND SUBDIVISIONS OF OHIO, MG-2 CD ROM digital dataset. 16 ofthese encompass the majority of area, the remaining 28 are much smallergeographic areas.
Column Comment.15: OHIO OTHER SUBDIVISION: Other irregular subdivision. Found in various LandSubdivision areas.
Column Comment.16: OHIO QUARTER TOWNSHIP: Quarter township irregular subdivision. Some OhioCongressional townships are divided into four quarters rather than multiple one-milesquare sections. Valid values are 1, 2, 3, 4, NE, NW, SE and SW. Found in theCONNECTICUT WESTERN RESERVE and UNITED STATES MILITARY DISTRICTLand Subdivision areas.
Column Comment.17: OHIO RANGE: Public or Private land survey system range number, typicallysequentially numbered east or west of the referenced meridian (PRINCIPALMERIDIAN). May also be referred to as CONGRESS RANGE. See WIKI foradditional information.
Column Comment.18: OHIO RANGE DIRECTION: The East or West direction of the OHIO RANGE numberrelative to the referenced meridian (PRINCIPAL MERIDIAN). May also be referred toas CONGRESS RANGE EW DIRECTION. See WIKI for additional information.
Column Comment.19: OHIO TOWNSHIP: Public or Private land survey system township number, typicallysequentially numbered north or south of the baseline associated with the referencedmeridian (PRINCIPAL MERIDIAN). May also be referred to as CONGRESSTOWNSHIP. See WIKIfor additional information.
Column Comment.20: OHIO TOWNSHIP DIRECTION: The North or South direction of the OHIOTOWNSHIP number relative to the baseline associated with the referenced meridian(PRINCIPAL MERIDIAN). May also be referred to as CONGRESS TOWNSHIP NSDIRECTION. See WIKI for additional information.
Column Comment.21: OHIO TOWNSHIP NAME: Name of the Civil, Named or Political township where thewell is located. These Civil, Named or Political townships typically have a differentareal extent than Public or Private land survey system townships, although in somecases they do exactly coincide.
Column Comment.22: OHIO TRACT: Tract irregular subdivision. Found in the CONNECTICUT WESTERNRESERVE,"FRENCH GRANTS and UNITED STATES MILITARY DISTRICT LandSubdivision areas.
Column Comment.23: OHIO TOWNSHIP LOT CODE: Either the Virginia Military Service (VMS) irregularsubdivision lot value(s) if the well is located in the VIRGINIA MILITARY DISTRICTOhio Land Subdivision, or the Lot irregular subdivision (including direction ifavailable) for other Ohio Land Subdivision areas.
Column Comment.24: OHIO TOWNSHIP SECTION CODE: Public OR Private land survey system sectionnumber.
Column Comment.25: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.26: PRINICPAL MERIDIAN CODE: A reference table identifying the valid principalmeridians used for legal survey descriptions. This is the f irst meridian in the surveyfrom which all other meridians are numbere d. For example Black Hi lls 1878, Boise1867, Chicksaw 1833, ...
Column Comment.27: REFERENCE PLAN NUM: Reference to a map prepared by a surveyor which showsthe land block in question
Column Comment.28: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.29: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.30: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.NOTE: In this table, the FK is added to allow you to describe the polygonal outline fora parcel.
Column Comment.31: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.32: SPOT_CODE: A code identifying a quatered division of a section, also known as thealiquot description (e.g. NW, SW, C NE etc)
Column Comment.33: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.34: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.35: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.36: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.37: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.38: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.39: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
